definition[0]: to translate spoken words from one language into another
example[0]: They spoke good Spanish, and promised to interpret for me.
definition[1]: to believe that something someone does or something that happens has a particular meaning
example[1]: His refusal to work late was interpreted as a lack of commitment to the company.
definition[2]: to explain the meaning of something
example[2]: Freudâ€™s attempts to interpret the meaning of dreams
definition[3]: to perform a part in a play, a piece of music etc in a way that shows your feelings about it or what you think it means
